title: Good French and Dutch Fonts
content:
Hello,  
I am doing a book on my recent travels to Europe. We went through Amsterdam and Paris, and I would like for the sans serif to be from one country and the serif to be from the other, but I am not sure where to start. The two fonts need to work with each other, but if possible, keep a characteristic from that region. If anyone knows any good fonts from these countries please let me know. THANKS.
author: Joseph

comments.content:
A wonderful sans from France is Peignot…..

Linda
For France and the Netherlands you’re spoilt for choice - what’s your budget?

It’s hard to get more French than Mandel’s flare-serif, which he uses for the body text of his book. But I forget the name. :-/ ITC Mendoza has a similar flavor.

Dutch: too many great choices! I might actually go for one that’s not too mainstream. Do you want oldschool or newschool?

But yeah, what’s your budget? :-/

hhp

Being that this is a personal project my budge can increase with desire. I want to make a nice book so if I love a font and feel it as the right one, I will spend what I need. All within reason though.

As for oldschool or newschool, I feel as if my photography in the book is very modern and personal, so maybe a more oldschool font will help to bring a balance to the book?

i looked at Mendoza and feel that it could be a good font for my use. So maybe if there is a good font from the Netherlands that would compliment it, I would love to know what it would be. The font has to work as a display size, and will be used more for short headlines that will included numerals.

Thanks so much for your expertise

-Joe

Would you use Mendoza for the text or for display? That would depend on things like the amount of text. In any case, I can’t immediately think of a Dutch face (old or new) that would nicely match Mendoza. Maybe FB Proforma\*? Anyway, a very oldschool Dutch font is Fleischmann (even though the guy was actually German).

\* [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Proforma](http://web.archive.org/web/20061116103930/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Proforma)

hhp
